title: b'Software Engineer'
job description:
b'At Altaeros we believe everyone should have access to the basic building blocks that allow a fulfilling, prosperous life, whether they live in a megacity or in the most rural of villages. We also believe in the power of innovation to make this a reality. Our SuperTower uses the world\xe2\x80\x99s first autonomous aerostat platform to permanently deploy high-speed mobile broadband in rural markets at a fraction of the cost of alternatives. With this new class of communication infrastructure, we aim to help hundreds of millions of people get online for the first time, unlocking untold new opportunities.

The Software Engineer position requires experience in designing and maintaining software on a variety of platforms. Successful candidates should have experience with as many of the following environments and languages- LabVIEW, Python, C#, Matlab or Simulink. We are a small but impressive team working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. The applicant will have the opportunity to work with all of the other engineering groups to further Altaeros\xe2\x80\x99 goal of delivering the next generation of infrastructure to rural and isolated communities around the world.

At Altaeros, we find that people do their best work when they are trusted to operate with a high level of respect and integrity. As such, Altaeros employees enjoy a highly flexible work schedule. Compensation includes salary, equity, and great benefits including unlimited paid time off, health, dental and life insurance, as well as, 401ks.

If interested, please submit your resume and cover letter with the subject [Software Engineer - Your Name] to Altaeros.jobs@altaeros.com.

Within Your First 6 Months You Will
Design, code and unit test new features, enhancements and bug fixes for autonomous controls in an Agile-Scrum environment
Develop full stack solutions ranging from front-end user interfaces through to back-end systems and all points in between
Assist in requirements definition with a cross-functional team of control engineers, aerodynamic engineers, system engineers and product owners
Actively test the code on the Altaeros SuperTower in Fremont, NH
Work with an experienced software team in a collaborative work environment

Qualifications
Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree (or equivalent) and 2-5 years software development experience
Proficiency in any \xe2\x80\x9chigh-level\xe2\x80\x9d language (C++, C#, Java, Python, etc.)
Experience with current database technologies (SQL, Cassandra, Hadoop, etc.)
Strong coding skills: writing, debug / test, deployment
Strong drive, initiative, organizational and communication skills
Experience in a variety of other systems, languages, processes, databases or data analysis a plus
A \xe2\x80\x9cStartup Attitude\xe2\x80\x9d: Quick learner, passionate, nimble, and adaptable

At Altaeros we believe everyone should have access to the basic building blocks that allow a fulfilling, prosperous life, whether they live in a megacity or in the most rural of villages. We also believe in the power of innovation to make this a reality. Our SuperTower uses the world\xe2\x80\x99s first autonomous aerostat platform to permanently deploy high-speed mobile broadband in rural markets at a fraction of the cost of alternatives. With this new class of communication infrastructure, we aim to help hundreds of millions of people get online for the first time, unlocking untold new opportunities. Learn more here: http://www.altaeros.com/'

title: b'Software Developer Engineer in Test'
job description:
b'Our Opportunity

Chewy is looking for Software Development Engineers in Test (SDET) based in Boston, MA. In this role, you will help build the automated test infrastructure for one of the fastest growing e-commerce platforms!

What You\xe2\x80\x99ll Do
Create and review test cases to maximize potential for automated test execution
Implement programmatic tests at varying scope (unit, component integration, system integration, performance)
Design and implement tools and frameworks to simplify test development, including simulators/mocks and data generators
Build test infrastructure to fit into our CI platform
Assess and evaluate new tools and testing methodologies
Provided peer feedback in design and code reviews
Design test automation in one of a variety of software domains: web-based e-commerce and customer service, native iOS and Android applications, financial and accounting systems, warehouse management and supply chain systems


What You\xe2\x80\x99ll Need
B.S. in Computer Science, Engineering, or other technical discipline
5+ years as a Software Development Engineer in Test
Solid programming experience in one or more object-oriented languages such as Java, , Javascript, Python, or C# (most of our development is in Java, with some other JVM languages)
Experience with Unit test frameworks or other integration test frameworks (open source or commercial)
Familiarity with RDBS and SQL
Understanding of TDD, BDD, and data-driven test practices
For UI test automation, experience with Selenium and/or Appium
Position may require travel


Bonus
Knowledge of Atlassian suite of tools (Jira, Bamboo, Confluence)
Experience working in Agile teams (Scrum, Kanban)
Familiarity with performance, scalability or security/pentest.
Knowledge of Chaos engineering
Knowledge of VM test environments and/or cloud-based compute environments

If you have a disability under the Americans with Disabilities Act or similar law, or you require a religious accommodation, and you wish to discuss potential accommodations related to applying for employment at our company, please contact HR@Chewy.com.

To access Chewy\xe2\x80\x99s Privacy Policy, which contains information regarding information collected from job applicants and how we use it, please click here: Chewy Privacy Policy (https://www.chewy.com/app/content/privacy).'

title: b'Software Engineer'
job description:

Sefas Innovation is a leading supplier of enterprise solutions to generate, process, optimize and distribute omni-channel customer communications. Our suite of products and services help enterprises achieve their digital transformation by supporting the modernization of legacy applications or the development of new customer communications, across any channel.
Our company delivers complex solutions and projects that are business-critical and have a deep impact on our clients.

We are growing strong and fast and we have an immediate opening for a Software Engineer. You will be directly responsible for the development and deployment of applications and solutions based on our products for our US customers and partners.
We provide you with initial training on our products and applications, you bring your enthusiasm and your technical skills to a multi-cultural, dynamic and fun environment and we are off to building the best team in our industry.

Analyze functional and technical requirements with our clients to design enterprise solutions for the production of printed and digital documents and communications
Design, develop, test and deploy applications and document production workflows relying on our suite of products and languages, Python (mostly) and sometimes Javascript, Java and/or C

Perform on-site installation of the applications developed
Support clients during User Acceptance Testing (UAT)
Provide high value consulting services

Proficient with at least one programming language (Python preferred)

Familiar with Object Oriented methodologies, such as UML
Proficient with Linux and MS Windows
Familiar with J2EE applications and web technologies (Tomcat, JavaScript, HTML5, XML, JSON, SOAP/REST APIs, etc.)

Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Enjoy inter-personal interaction and communication
Logical, structured, organized and precise
Creative and enjoy solving problems
Personal and inter-personal skills

Eager to learn new things, discover and experiment
Open to grow as the company grows

title: b'Software Engineer, Risk'
job description:
b"About Us

Venmo was founded on the principles of breaking down the intimidating barriers around financial transactions to make them intuitive, friendly, and even fun. And it worked: people love sending money with Venmo, and we\xe2\x80\x99re growing by leaps and bounds!

But we\xe2\x80\x99re only just getting started. We want to take that magic of sending money with Venmo and cascade it into every place where people use money. That means connecting people to their money in the most intuitive and fun way possible, then connecting people with each other. Users already love Venmo, but we know there are lots of things we haven\xe2\x80\x99t thought of to make the experience of using Venmo even more delightful and valuable. All that\xe2\x80\x99s going to take a lot of figuring out. Let\xe2\x80\x99s figure it out together!

Engineering at Venmo

At Venmo, we are creating a product that people love. We strive to create a delightful user experience while connecting the world and empowering people through payments. We are looking for intellectually curious people who want to be inspired and inspire others to change the world.

Engineering is a craft, and at Venmo we want the internals of our software to be as elegant as the end user experience we are designing. We spend our days scaling our payment backend services and building new features to meet and exceed our user\xe2\x80\x99s needs and wants. We teach and learn from one another, and push each other to be at our creative and analytical best. We work to push our technology forward with respect to functionality, performance, reliability and scalability.

Risk Senior Software Engineer

As a Senior Software Engineer for Venmo Risk Engineering you will be involved in the design and development of product solutions that help fight financial fraud, tackle chargebacks & disputes handling in the world of connected payments. Venmo fraud product solutions supports screening payment transactions of 27.4 million monthly active users and had a transaction volume of 100 billion dollars in 2019. We have a YoY growth rate of 70%. Given all these fun challenges, we are a fast-paced organization going through rapid growth and solving technical challenges at exponential scale. As an organization, we have a strong culture of committing to goals and delivering on timelines.

We are looking for technologists with the highest levels of technical talent, programming skills, attention to performance and scalability, communication skills and a keen desire to deeply understand our product.

What You'll Do
Design, estimate and implement new and refactored software services on the platform securely, reliably and at scale. Take ownership for quality of design and implementation of software components
Deliver high quality code on time and follow our SDLC process
Work with Tech-leads / Architects to validate designs
Have an appetite to learn and contribute to complex projects alongside your colleagues
Interact with various non-engineering teams such as product, SRE, risk analysts and senior leadership
Participate in code reviews
Follow engineering best practices


What We're Looking For
4+ yrs experience in all phases of enterprise software design, development and testing
4+ yrs experience Java, Python or equivalent high level programming language
2+ yrs experience with RDBMS and NoSQL data stores , caching solutions (e.g. Redis, ElastiCache) and messaging/queuing protocols/systems such as Kafka/AMQP/RabbitMQ
Strong communication skills with the ability to understand and explain technical issues to a non-technical audience
Being collaborative, willingness to learn and also share/teach the team


What Will Really Get Our Attention
Experience in payments processing or payments domain
Experience in risk or compliance domains
Experience integrating disparate systems together
Django and/or Celery experience

We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don't hesitate to apply."

title: b'Software Engineer'
job description:
b"Everyone communicates. It\xe2\x80\x99s the essence of the human experience. How we communicate is evolving. Technology is reshaping the way we live, learn and thrive. The epicenter of this transformation is the network\xe2\x80\x94our passion. Our experts are rethinking the purpose, role and usage of networks to help our customers increase bandwidth, expand capacity, enhance efficiency, speed deployment and simplify migration. From remote cell sites to massive sports arenas, from busy airports to state-of-the-art data centers\xe2\x80\x94 we provide the essential expertise and vital infrastructure your business needs to succeed. The world\xe2\x80\x99s most advanced networks rely on CommScope connectivity.

Perform unit and integration testing of the product.

Independently resolve technical problems, initiating design changes and providing engineering support to access customer needs and resolve field issues.
Generate required product development documentation including functional specifications and detailed design documents.
Interface with other development groups to collaborate on new product developments.
Strong communication skills required, for verbal communication and in written communication

Work closely with other engineers to develop new products
Work on extensions of existing products
Suggest and implement improvements on current products
Hands on of algorithm complexities
Development of the next generation software
Basic Database systems - indexes, filters
DOCSIS knowledge is preferable.
Data communication knowledge is a MUST

A computer science or electrical engineering bachelor's degree is required. Master\xe2\x80\x99s degree is a plus.

It is the policy of CommScope to provide Equal Employment Opportunities to all individuals based on merit, qualifications and abilities. CommScope does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, gender (including pregnancy), national origin, age or any other characteristics as protected by law. Furthermore, this contractor and subcontractor shall abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-300.5(a) and 41 CFR 60-741.5(a). These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified protected veterans and qualified individuals on the basis of disability, and require affirmative action by covered prime contractors and subcontractors to employ and advance in employment qualified protected veterans and qualified individuals with disabilities."

job description:

Who You'll Work With

title: b'Junior Software Engineer'
job description:
b'Summary:
The main function of a software developer is to develop and design web applications and software. A typical software developer is responsible for directing web site content creation, enhancement and maintenance. Provides expertise and direction in the development and/or modification of computer-based scientific, technical, and business software systems.

The ideal candidate is a well-rounded technical professional with well-esablished technical, communication, and leadership skills. The new team member will be assigned to a project that is underway to rewrite a current system with modern, secure technology.
Key Skills:
The Senior Engineer must be able to demonstrate experience designing, re-designing, or updating legacy software systems, and become the subject matter and system expert.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Highly self-motivated individual who has the ability to work independently as well as in a team environment
\xe2\x80\xa2 Outstanding verbal and written communication skills

\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to design, develop, test, support, maintain and debug software applications

\xe2\x80\xa2 Solid understanding and practical knowledge of object oriented design and programming concepts
\xe2\x80\xa2 Comfort with Integrated Developer Environments such as Visual Studio
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience creating and maintaining data forms with tools such as .NET data binding for Windows applications
\xe2\x80\xa2 Familiar with source control systems such as Visual Studio Team Foundation or DevOps
Database Skills:

\xe2\x80\xa2 Expertise in database management via direct UPDATES, embedded SQL and dynamic SQL such as stored procedures

\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience in transforming business requirements to data objects and relationships
\xe2\x80\xa2 Applied use and understanding of database principles \xe2\x80\x93 entities, relationships, indexes, triggers, normalization
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience writing stored procedures, functions, and packages'

title: b'Software Engineer, SDN / Networking / Embedded Systems'
job description:
b"Job description

Arista Networks is looking for world-class software engineers at multiple levels to join our team to build product features related to SDN, Routing Protocols, Network Management, Packet Forwarding Engines, Linux kernel and Network OS infrastructure. You will be part of a fast paced, high caliber team building the software for the routing and switching products used to build the industry's largest data center networks.  
At Arista, you will own your projects from definition to deployment, and you will be responsible for the quality of everything you deliver. You will also have the opportunity to work on multiple projects and areas based on business needs and personal interest.
This role demands a strong and broad software engineering background. Your role will not be limited to any single aspect of software development at Arista, but will cover all aspects of software development spanning the addition of new features, debugging problems and fine tuning code for scalability and performance.

Responsibilities:
Architect, design and develop features and solutions. Develop tests for all code to ensure quality. Fix bugs and refactor code as needed.
Review and contribute to the specifications and implementations written by other team members.
Provide technical leadership across features, projects and tools.
Work with Customer Support Engineers to analyze problems in customer networks and provide fixes. for those problems when needed in the form of new software releases or software patches.
Work with the System Test Engineers to analyze problems found in their tests and provide fixes for those problems.
Mentor new and junior engineers to bring them up to speed in Arista's software development environment.

Requirements:
At least BS Computer Science + 3 years' experience, or MS Computer Science + 2 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience, Ph.D. in Computer Science or equivalent work experience.
Knowledge of one or more of C++, Python, Go, C.
Knowledge of UNIX or Linux.
Understanding of IP networking and/or distributed systems.
Hands on experience in the design and development of Ethernet bridging or routing related software or distributed systems software.
Applied understanding of software engineering principles.
Strong problem solving and software troubleshooting skills.
Ability to design a solution and implement features independently. Ability to work on small teams solving problems by building features and driving the project with limited oversight..

Arista is an Equal Opportunity Employer: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.
 "

title: b'Software Engineer'
job description:
b'Software Engineer Opening in Natick, MA!

Apex Systems combines with parent company On Assignment to make it the 2nd largest IT staffing agency in the country.

Here Are The Details

Apex has an opportunity for a Software Engineer in the Natick area. This is a 6 month contract-to-hire position and the pay rate is flexible depending on experience.

For applicants who are interested in this Software Engineer opportunity; please send a Word resume to Matthew Bonvouloir, Technical Recruiter, at mbonvouloir@apexsystems.com.

Position: Software Engineer
Location: Natick, MA
Rate: Negotiable based on experience
Duration: 6 months contract-to-hire

Position Description

Our client is a startup company with a plan to disrupt the clinical testing market. The focus is on building NGS diagnostic and software solutions from the ground up, leveraging experiences in genomics, data analytics, clinical testing and patient focus to quickly innovate and penetrate the market.

We are seeking a software engineer who is passionate about solving data processing algorithm and computation challenges in genome technologies and applications to clinical diagnostics. The applicant will be responsible for providing software support for our core technology and product development, with opportunities to design and build the infrastructure for data management and analysis.

This exceptional opportunity offers the chance to work at big data analysis and cloud development supporting the forefront of genomic and cellular understanding of cancer. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to innovate and to work closely with experimental, regulatory, biological and clinical collaborators.

Responsibilities
Develop and maintain software packages for the analysis of DNA high-throughput sequencing data.
Work with software quality assurance and test engineers to evaluate algorithms and improve software products.
Work closely with data scientists to evaluate and troubleshoot experimental methods.
Capable of working in a team environment with good communication.
Be trained to understand and work with ISO/FDA compliance on some IVD related software products.


Required Skills

Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Computer Science or related discipline.
Experience programming in a professional environment.
Demonstrated proficiency in Python or other scripting languages.
Familiarity with SQL and databases.
Proficiency in Linux and cloud computing.

Desired Skills (not required but candidate will have exposure to these skills in this role):

Extremely interested in software engineering problems as well as algorithm challenges.
Familiarity with TDD and BDD methodologies.
Knowledge of common bioinformatics tools and databases is a plus.
Experience in bioinformatics and NGS.

Additional Benefits

For this opportunity, you will also be eligible for benefits through Apex for the contract period, 401K, medical/health benefits options, a W2 hourly rate, weekly pay, and direct deposit!

EEO Employer

title: b'Software Engineer II'
job description:
b"ABOUT THE JOB The Medical Reporting Team is responsible for the creation of individualized reports for trial and therapy options for patients and oncologists. The Software Engineer II role works as part of the software team responsible for the au...

About The Job

The Medical Reporting Team is responsible for the creation of individualized reports for trial and therapy options for patients and oncologists. The Software Engineer II role works as part of the software team responsible for the automated and manual content curation features of this report. The position works together with the team, technical lead, product owner and scrum master to deliver functionality on an iterative basis with the goal of improving patient care through improving information on reports.

Key Responsibilities

Technical
Attend cross-functional meetings with project managers, end users and other internal and external stakeholders at pre-set intervals to gather information for requirements.
Define and document architecture, design requirements, functional requirements, and formal technical specifications based upon information provided.
Write, test, and refactor code that is elegant, clean, and adheres to patterns and established standards.
Maintain efforts for product or platform to be resilient, cloud-native, secure, and scalable.
Integrate and deploy code using provisioning tools, release tools, and continuous Integration CI/Continuous Delivery CD pipeline.
Engineer installation qualifications and operational qualifications.

Project Delivery
Deliver complex products that are production hardened, high quality and on time based on the team's planning activities.
Contribute to common code.
Prioritize tasks based on communicated goals and business/product urgency.
In design reviews or PRs, spends bulk of time on issues pertaining to the code or feature.
Proactively identifies, clarifies, and fixes problems, inconsistencies or technical limitations of requirements.
Help define and participate in software development processes that leverages best practice and supports continuous product delivery.
Conform to all aspects of the software development life cycle.

Collaboration
Presents findings and responds to questions and feedback.
Perform research focusing on usability, scalability, performance and trade-offs, and share the knowledge with the team.
Clarifies assumptions, needs and goals upfront to minimize re-work.
Offers actionable and helpful feedback to others (pairing, design reviews, code reviews, etc).
Proactively participate in team planning activities and sprint ceremonies (including but not limited to: sprint planning, quarterly planning, and stand-ups).
Collaboration with other team members in working with stakeholders to define requirements based on user and business needs.


Other
Create new features for the Medical Reporting platform based on user feedback and business needs.
Provide consistent and on-going attention to the quality and reliability of the Medical Reporting software as a product.
Other responsibilities related to software engineering as assigned.


Qualifications

Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree.
1+ year(s) of software engineering experience.


Preferred Qualifications
Degree in Software Engineering, Programming, Management Information Systems, Computer Science or related field.
2+ years of software engineering experience.
2+ year(s) of experience working with Amazon Web Services or similar cloud platform.
Prior experience with software patterns like Command Query Responsibility Segregation (CQRS) and Domain Driven Design.
Good understanding and experience with the Spring/Springboot framework.
Good knowledge and experience working with data modeling and database development techniques (Postgres/Oracle databases, JSON data, Database Transactions).
Architect complex software engineering solutions with an emphasis on creating highly performant services.
Experience building serverless applications, utilizing infrastructure similar to AWS SQS and Lambda.
Experience in genomics or other field of biology/biotech.
Expertise in highly automated continuous delivery environments.
Experience building and delivering software utilizing modern web technologies and tools (Javascript, HTML/CSS, application frameworks, etc.).
Experience with testing tools and processes associated with modern web technologies.
Experience building application features based on user input and requirement definition.
Experience with containerized delivery/deployment of software (Docker, Kubernetes, Amazon AWS ECS, etc.).
Strong interpersonal skills including collaboration and problem solving.
Understanding of HIPAA and importance of patient data privacy."

title: b'Software Engineer'
job description:
b"TL;DR

High-impact software development jobs for smart people.

Code that saves lives.

As a software developer at Epic, you\xe2\x80\x99ll write software that impacts the lives of 75% of Americans and 250 million patients around the world. Working in your own office, surrounded by thousands of high-caliber developers, you\xe2\x80\x99ll use modern development methodologies and employ user-centered design, analytics, and machine learning tools to drive innovation in healthcare. Using leading-edge technologies and languages like JS, TS, and C#, you\xe2\x80\x99ll invent better ways to reduce medical errors, streamline record sharing between hospitals, and provide the quality of care a patient deserves.

Write software for the most innovative health systems on the planet.

All the Top 20 health systems in U.S. News and World Report are Epic customers. Our community includes major systems like the Mayo Clinic, Johns Hopkins, Cleveland Clinic, and Kaiser Permanente, as well as leading academic medical centers at the University of Wisconsin, University of Michigan, University of California, University of Texas, The Ohio State University, and many more.

Work in your own office, eat delicious food, and travel the world.

We don\xe2\x80\x99t believe in cubicles. (Well, we believe they exist, but\xe2\x80\xa6) You will work in an individual office that will heighten your ability to get stuff done. For lunch, visit King\xe2\x80\x99s Cross or Cassiopeia for a wide array of meal options, or go to one of our smaller, themed bistros, featuring wood-rotisserie, pan-Asian, and Latin-inspired cuisine. All meals are restaurant-quality but cost only a few dollars, and they\xe2\x80\x99re prepared by a team comprised of kitchen talent from restaurants around the country. And, after five years here, you\xe2\x80\x99ll earn a four-week sabbatical anywhere in the world. Staff have kayaked in Patagonia, attended a Beyonc\xc3\xa9 concert in Ireland, built a library in Tanzania, and run a marathon in Antarctica.

Live affordably in a city known for its rising tech talent.

Epic is located just outside Madison, Wisconsin the second fastest growing market for tech talent in the United States and home to the state capital and the University of Wisconsin. Madison, a city surrounded by water, has received accolades for being the greenest city in America (NerdWallet), the best city for renters (SmartAsset), fittest city in America (Fitbit), and, for the gamers, is one of a handful of US cities to have a Killer Queen arcade game, located at Madison\xe2\x80\x99s first arcade bar.

More than just important work.

We offer comprehensive benefits to keep you healthy and happy as you grow in your life and career, and your merit-based compensation will reflect the impact your work has on the company and our customers. You'll also be eligible for annual raises and bonuses, as well as stock grants, which give you an even greater stake in the success of Epic and our customers. Epic is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action (W/M/Vets/Disability) employer. Please see our full non-discrimination statement at https //careers.epic.com/EEO.

Requirements

Open to relocation to the Madison, WI area (we will bring you here to explore the city for yourself)
BS/BA or greater in Computer Science, Mathematics, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related field
A history of academic excellence or professional success
Eligible to work in the United States without visa sponsorship (persons with appropriate qualifications and eligible for TN status under NAFTA may apply)"

title: b'Software Engineer'
job description:
b"Software Engineer
Boston, MA

Overview:
VC backed startup with a work class team of industry experts who have had several successful exits in the past. They have created a healthcare software platform to remove the friction from how payers and physicians interact. It allows many clinical services to get immediate approval with no red tape. Doctors can give the right care and not worry about profits.

Join a new engineering team with a world class CTO. The team has big ambitions with no technical debt. You will have an immediate influence on the company providing invaluable direction & influence on technology decisions.

What you will do:

Work on a professionally mature, fast-paced, team
Technical leadership throughout the technical design and sprint process
End to end feature releases and platform enhancements
Technical design process
Make data-driven decisions
Feature design, development, testing, and delivery of our cloud platform and web applications
Contribute across all parts of our platform
Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies or services to maximize development efficiency
Contribute to developing a culture of testing, quality, and attention to detail by supporting industry leading practices such as writing and maintaining comprehensive test coverage
Actively participate in ensuring disciplined approach to healthcare security
Mentor junior members of the team

What we are looking for:

Software development experience building and deploying full stack web applications
Ability to build a quality product and want to own it end-to-end
Experience with common software development practices such as version control, unit testing, and CI/CD

We use a modern tech stack that includes:
Java, React, Spring/Springboot, MongoDB, AWS

Your background & education:
Bachelor's degree in computer science, software engineering, or equivalent experience
3+ years of experience"

title: b'Junior Software Engineer / Data Scientists (100% remote)'
job description:
b"Several Jr. Software Engineers (Python/JavaScript) / Data Scientists needed for long term renewable energy related project \xe2\x80\x93 100 % remote
  The Midtown Group has been selected to fulfill ten to fifteen long-term assignments for the nation\xe2\x80\x99s leading and most prestigious energy association that needs an outstanding team of junior software engineers and data scientists for a federal renewable energy analytics project.
  The goal of the program is to provide simulation studio to better understand the financial and engineering impacts of distributed energy resources (solar, energy storage, etc.) on the electric distribution system. This project is funded by the U.S. Department of Energy Advanced Research Projects Administration (ARPA-E). The project builds on and improves the open source Open Modeling Framework software which has been created to provide engineering and financial analysis to electric utilities.
  Those selected will support the organization's efforts by conducting detailed research and through the development of software. These opportunities offer the chance to make a meaningful contribution to clean energy initiatives while utilizing technology and gaining invaluable experience.  

Previous contractors on closely related projects have enjoyed working with prototype technologies and having the opportunity to become published or contributing authors pertaining to ARPA-E, the Advanced Research Projects Agency-Energy, and other related publications such as IEEE, the world\xe2\x80\x99s largest technical professional organization dedicated to advancing technology for the benefit of humanity.
  Jr. Software & Data Scientist responsibilities include:
  \xc2\xb7 Participate in the full software development life cycle including requirements analysis, design, implementation, testing and deployment.
\xc2\xb7 Source code fulfilling the tasks described above uploaded to the OMF source code repository.
\xc2\xb7 Prepare weekly progress reports for discussion with the analytics Program Manager.
\xc2\xb7 Additional reporting as needed to keep other project partners informed of the project status.
  Desired background of Jr. Software Engineer and Data Scientist candidates:
  \xc2\xb7 A Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree from a top tier school in a technical field, preferably electrical engineering, computer science, or applied math or four (4) years and some directly applicable experience.
\xc2\xb7 Experience with either the programming language Python and/or JavaScript.
\xc2\xb7 An active GitHub
\xc2\xb7 A passion for technology, data science, research, and an appreciation for renewable and/or clean energy
\xc2\xb7 Authorization to work in the USA.
  Additional details:
  Pay rate:  $26 to $28 per hour, DOE, plus annual reviews that will include pay increases that range from 15% to 50%, title changes, increases in responsibility, and possible leadership opportunities.
Duration:  36 months
Target interview time frame:  Immediate
Projected start date:  Estimated between April 13th or 20th, 2020

Project location, for those interested in working onsite:  Arlington, VA.

Qualified, interested, and available candidates are encouraged to send resumes and GitHub links ASAP.  Exploratory calls welcome.  "

title: b'Software Engineer'
job description:

Desirable:

Fresenius Medical Care North America maintains a drug-free workplace in accordance with applicable federal and state laws."

title: b'Software Engineer'
job description:
b"Meet Our Team

Pega provides cutting-edge solutions for some of the world\xe2\x80\x99s largest organizations that solve real business problems within a matter of a few weeks without writing any code. One of the most insightful parts of any business application is the data: it needs to be visualized in a way that is easy for an end-user to interpret making it easy to detect patterns and trends within your organization. Data visualizations also need to be responsive and perform well on all devices and browsers, must be interactive and also must be accessible to all types of users.

That\xe2\x80\x99s a challenging set of expectations to meet. That\xe2\x80\x99s where you come in.

You will be joining the Reporting and Data Analytics teams to help build out our brand-new data visualization technology into our suite of CRM applications.

Picture Yourself At Pega

Pega is changing the way the world builds software. In this role, you\xe2\x80\x99ll help us define and deliver the next generation of the Pega Infinity platform, driving the no-code capabilities that enable our clients to build amazing user interfaces and data visualization capabilities and rapidly deploy them in a matter of weeks.

This is your chance to get hands-on with leading-edge Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) technology and accelerate your career at a fast-paced and rapidly growing company.

What You'll Do At Pega

Design, test and develop high-quality reporting and visualization components using React and D3
Look outward to identify the latest data visualization trends and keep abreast of web and accessibility standards. Showcase how to use the latest and greatest to deliver some easy to use visualization technology for the Pega Infinity platform and our different applications.
Assist with highly escalated customer technical issues and drive them to completion to ensure the overall success of our customers
Mentor and coach junior staff members on technical topics

Who You Are

You are a front-end developer passionate about the latest web technologies and 3rd party frameworks (ReactJS).
Data visualization excites you and you understand how to present data in an easy to use and compelling way.
You thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative, team-oriented, and cross-functional environment.
You understand the importance of delivering high-quality code with excellent code coverage using unit and integration tests
You strive for simple, elegant solutions to complex problems.
You are eager to learn and always up for a challenge.

What You've Accomplished

3+ years professional experience in UI Engineering in agile/scrum environments
Familiarity with data visualization libraries such as D3, WebGL or FusionCharts
Experience with React and state management libraries like Redux, RXJS...
Bonus points for: Object-Oriented Programming language such as Java; experience with writing test automation using tools such as Jasmine, Puppeteer or RSPEC

Pega Offers You

Gartner and Forrester acclaimed technology leadership across our categories of products in a massive emerging market
Continuous learning and development opportunities
An innovative, inclusive, agile, flexible, and fun work environment
Competitive global benefits program inclusive of pay + bonus incentive, employee equity in the company

Job ID: 10152

As an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, Pegasystems will not discriminate in its employment practices due to an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, genetic information, veteran or disability status, or any other category protected by law.
Accessibility \xe2\x80\x93 If you require accessibility assistance applying for open positions please contact PegaApplication@pega.com .

Labor Condition Applications
GDPR Candidate Privacy Notice
Pegasystems Limited UK Gender Pay Gap Statement"

title: b'Software Engineer in Test'
job description:
b'Job Title: Software Engineer in Test
Job Summary
Software Engineer in Test
Interested in contributing to the creation of the next-gen Hybrid Datacenter? Want to work with other smart and exciting people who are changing the way people think about their data? Want to join an innovating, fast growing, highly profitable business?
NetApp ONTAP Cloud Volumes offer robust enterprise storage services that are delivered using our native cloud file service for major hyperscalers such as AWS, Azure and many more. It combines the best of the cloud, in terms of agility and granular capacity scaling, with the flexibility, resilience, and cost efficiency. Leading organizations worldwide count on NetApp for software, systems and services to manage and store their data. Customers value our teamwork, expertise and passion for helping them succeed now and into the future.
The NetApp ONTAP cloud team is looking for strong software engineers to join the team that\xe2\x80\x99s building the products that will shape the world\xe2\x80\x99s software defined datacenters and improve IT ability to manage storage in the cloud.
As a member of the team you will:
\xc2\xb7         Build automated test scripts for to validate the NetApp ONTAP Cloud product
\xc2\xb7         Contribute expertise to software testing of deployment applications and ONTAP functions on cloud platforms.
\xc2\xb7         Perform automated/manual testing and track issues/defects
\xc2\xb7         Work within agile project teams, continuously releasing application software
\xc2\xb7         Responsible for ensuring the timely and high-quality release of modules in ONTAP Select
Job Requirements
Essential Functions:
\xc2\xb7         Write and test high quality code
         Troubleshoot and debug code
\xc2\xb7         Develop tools, libraries, and scripts to facilitate automated test execution
\xc2\xb7         Contribute to feature definition and design
\xc2\xb7         Have fun while being challenged and learning something new every day
Requirements:
\xc2\xb7         Beneficial to have experience with and understanding Enterprise storage systems (NFS,CIFS, iSCSI) and NetApp storage management applications (OnCommand Cloud Manager, OnCommand Unified Manager,       SnapDrive & SnapManager)
\xc2\xb7         Exposure in virtualization technologies
\xc2\xb7         Experience with cloud environments such as AWS, Azure and GCP
\xc2\xb7         Deep expertise and hands on experience with development in Perl and Python
\xc2\xb7         Work collaboratively within a team of other engineers and have strong influencing and leadership skills
\xc2\xb7         Proven abilities in the following disciplines: software testing, test case writing, automated script development and process improvement
\xc2\xb7         Strong aptitude for learning new technologies
\xc2\xb7         Strong understanding of concepts related to computer architecture, data structures and standard programming practices
\xc2\xb7         Work on complex issues where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation.
\xc2\xb7         Possess excellent written and verbal communication skills
\xc2\xb7         Manage multiple priorities and tasks in a dynamic work environment
Responsibility:
\xc2\xb7         Responsible for a mix of structured and unstructured tasks
\xc2\xb7         Apply attained experiences and knowledge in solving routine to moderately complex problems
\xc2\xb7         Perform software development and testing within the Software Defined Core Infrastructure (SDCI) group in problem solving and design efforts
\xc2\xb7         Work within agile project teams, continuously releasing application software
\xc2\xb7         Responsible for ensuring the timely and high-quality release of modules in ONTAP Select
Interaction:
\xc2\xb7         Interact primarily with direct manager and the technical team on assigned projects. There may be communication with employees in other functions within the business unit as required.
\xc2\xb7         General direction is provided on routine work and detailed direction is provided on new projects and assignments. There will be on-going reviews of activities and priorities.
\xc2\xb7         Participate as an important contributor to team projects
Education
Education
Typically requires a minimum of 5 years of related experience with a Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree; or 3 years and a Master\xe2\x80\x99s degree; or a PhD with 3 years of experience; or equivalent work experience in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Information Systems or an equivalent degree.
  Education and experience:
\xc2\xb7         We are seeking candidates that have completed a Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s, Master\xe2\x80\x99s or Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Information Systems or an equivalent degree.
\xc2\xb7         Passion for writing or testing high quality code
\xc2\xb7         Broad knowledge of computer science fundamentals
  About Ontap Cloud
ONTAP Cloud is a software-only storage appliance that runs the ONTAP data management software in the cloud. You can use ONTAP Cloud for production workloads, disaster recovery, DevOps, file shares, and database management.
ONTAP Cloud extends enterprise storage to the cloud with the following key features:
Storage efficiencies
Leverage built-in data deduplication, data compression, thin provisioning, and cloning to minimize storage costs.
High availability
Ensure enterprise reliability and continuous operations in case of failures in your cloud environment (AWS only).
Data replication
ONTAP Cloud leverages SnapMirror, NetApp\xe2\x80\x99s industry-leading replication technology, to replicate on-premises data to the cloud so it\xe2\x80\x99s easy to have secondary copies available for multiple use cases.
Data tiering
Switch between high and low-performance storage pools on-demand without taking applications offline (AWS only).
Application consistency
Ensure consistency of NetApp Snapshot copies using the NetApp SnapManager tool suite.
Data security
Secure your data at rest with advanced data encryption (AWS only).
About NetApp
Leading organizations worldwide count on NetApp for software, systems and services to manage and store their data. Customers value our teamwork, expertise and passion for helping them succeed now and into the future.
Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Vets/Disabled.
Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Vets/Disabled.'

title: b'Software Developer In Test'
job description:
b'Role

title: b'Software Engineer'
job description:
b'Job Description

The Purpose of Your Role

To be a part of the Money Market Technology Team, a group within Fidelity Investment Asset Management Technology division that designs, develops and supports Portfolio & Cash Management, Trading, and Market Surveillance software applications for the Fixed Income MM business. Fidelity\xe2\x80\x99s Money Market Business is the market leader in managing over $800 Billion in customer assets.

The Expertise We\xe2\x80\x99re Looking For

We are seeking an experienced software developer to assist with the on-going project work of the trading, cash management, and market surveillance applications used by the MM Desk. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 2 years of experience in user interface or Java server side and SQL (Oracle) development, ideally with financial services exposure. He/She will join an agile scrum team and play a hands-on role in coordination, design and development of application releases for the Money Market product line!
A strong understanding of the software development lifecycle process, preference is with Scrum / Agile
Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or Engineering or similar.


The Skills You Bring
Demonstrable experience and knowledge of Java (server-side) object-oriented programming skills.
Proven experience with User Interface programming skills
Familiarity with functional programming skills (preferably Scala)
Experience in SQL development
Effectively work on a small development team
Self-motivated, driven, and have a strong client focus and results orientation approach


Primary Responsibilities

Work with product owners and business analysts to understand the business and technical requirements. Define the system requirements and technical design for specific components within a release.
Active hands on role in for either user interface (Angular or C#/.Net;) or Java and/or Scala/AKKA based middle tier services,

Coordinate and deploy product releases. Provide technical leadership for junior team members (both for those co-located in Merrimack or for other team members located in India).
On-call rotation to provide Level 3 production support for our applications.

Develop, document and communicate design artifacts with in the team. Maintain trusted relationships with business partners. Ability to be highly productive in an agile project delivery environment!

Company Overview

At Fidelity, we are focused on making our financial expertise broadly accessible and effective in helping people live the lives they want. We are a privately held company that places a high degree of value in creating and nurturing a work environment that attracts the best talent and reflects our commitment to our associates. For information about working at Fidelity, visit FidelityCareers.com

Category

Certifications:

Information Technology'

title: b'Software Engineer'
job description:
b'At Altaeros we believe everyone should have access to the basic building blocks that allow a fulfilling, prosperous life, whether they live in a megacity or in the most rural of villages. We also believe in the power of innovation to make this a reality. Our SuperTower uses the world\xe2\x80\x99s first autonomous aerostat platform to permanently deploy high-speed mobile broadband in rural markets at a fraction of the cost of alternatives. With this new class of communication infrastructure, we aim to help hundreds of millions of people get online for the first time, unlocking untold new opportunities.

The Software Engineer position requires experience in designing and maintaining software on a variety of platforms. Successful candidates should have experience with as many of the following environments and languages- LabVIEW, Python, C#, Matlab or Simulink. We are a small but impressive team working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. The applicant will have the opportunity to work with all of the other engineering groups to further Altaeros\xe2\x80\x99 goal of delivering the next generation of infrastructure to rural and isolated communities around the world.

At Altaeros, we find that people do their best work when they are trusted to operate with a high level of respect and integrity. As such, Altaeros employees enjoy a highly flexible work schedule. Compensation includes salary, equity, and great benefits including unlimited paid time off, health, dental and life insurance, as well as, 401ks.

If interested, please submit your resume and cover letter with the subject [Software Engineer - Your Name] to Altaeros.jobs@altaeros.com.

Within Your First 6 Months You Will
Design, code and unit test new features, enhancements and bug fixes for autonomous controls in an Agile-Scrum environment
Develop full stack solutions ranging from front-end user interfaces through to back-end systems and all points in between
Assist in requirements definition with a cross-functional team of control engineers, aerodynamic engineers, system engineers and product owners
Actively test the code on the Altaeros SuperTower in Fremont, NH
Work with an experienced software team in a collaborative work environment

Qualifications
Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree (or equivalent) and 2-5 years software development experience
Proficiency in any \xe2\x80\x9chigh-level\xe2\x80\x9d language (C++, C#, Java, Python, etc.)
Experience with current database technologies (SQL, Cassandra, Hadoop, etc.)
Strong coding skills: writing, debug / test, deployment
Strong drive, initiative, organizational and communication skills
Experience in a variety of other systems, languages, processes, databases or data analysis a plus
A \xe2\x80\x9cStartup Attitude\xe2\x80\x9d: Quick learner, passionate, nimble, and adaptable

At Altaeros we believe everyone should have access to the basic building blocks that allow a fulfilling, prosperous life, whether they live in a megacity or in the most rural of villages. We also believe in the power of innovation to make this a reality. Our SuperTower uses the world\xe2\x80\x99s first autonomous aerostat platform to permanently deploy high-speed mobile broadband in rural markets at a fraction of the cost of alternatives. With this new class of communication infrastructure, we aim to help hundreds of millions of people get online for the first time, unlocking untold new opportunities. Learn more here: http://www.altaeros.com/'

title: b'Software Developer Engineer in Test'
job description:
b'Our Opportunity

Chewy is looking for Software Development Engineers in Test (SDET) based in Boston, MA. In this role, you will help build the automated test infrastructure for one of the fastest growing e-commerce platforms!

What You\xe2\x80\x99ll Do
Create and review test cases to maximize potential for automated test execution
Implement programmatic tests at varying scope (unit, component integration, system integration, performance)
Design and implement tools and frameworks to simplify test development, including simulators/mocks and data generators
Build test infrastructure to fit into our CI platform
Assess and evaluate new tools and testing methodologies
Provided peer feedback in design and code reviews
Design test automation in one of a variety of software domains: web-based e-commerce and customer service, native iOS and Android applications, financial and accounting systems, warehouse management and supply chain systems


What You\xe2\x80\x99ll Need
B.S. in Computer Science, Engineering, or other technical discipline
5+ years as a Software Development Engineer in Test
Solid programming experience in one or more object-oriented languages such as Java, , Javascript, Python, or C# (most of our development is in Java, with some other JVM languages)
Experience with Unit test frameworks or other integration test frameworks (open source or commercial)
Familiarity with RDBS and SQL
Understanding of TDD, BDD, and data-driven test practices
For UI test automation, experience with Selenium and/or Appium
Position may require travel


Bonus
Knowledge of Atlassian suite of tools (Jira, Bamboo, Confluence)
Experience working in Agile teams (Scrum, Kanban)
Familiarity with performance, scalability or security/pentest.
Knowledge of Chaos engineering
Knowledge of VM test environments and/or cloud-based compute environments

If you have a disability under the Americans with Disabilities Act or similar law, or you require a religious accommodation, and you wish to discuss potential accommodations related to applying for employment at our company, please contact HR@Chewy.com.

To access Chewy\xe2\x80\x99s Privacy Policy, which contains information regarding information collected from job applicants and how we use it, please click here: Chewy Privacy Policy (https://www.chewy.com/app/content/privacy).'

title: b'Software Engineer, Risk'
job description:
b"About Us

Venmo was founded on the principles of breaking down the intimidating barriers around financial transactions to make them intuitive, friendly, and even fun. And it worked: people love sending money with Venmo, and we\xe2\x80\x99re growing by leaps and bounds!

But we\xe2\x80\x99re only just getting started. We want to take that magic of sending money with Venmo and cascade it into every place where people use money. That means connecting people to their money in the most intuitive and fun way possible, then connecting people with each other. Users already love Venmo, but we know there are lots of things we haven\xe2\x80\x99t thought of to make the experience of using Venmo even more delightful and valuable. All that\xe2\x80\x99s going to take a lot of figuring out. Let\xe2\x80\x99s figure it out together!

Engineering at Venmo

At Venmo, we are creating a product that people love. We strive to create a delightful user experience while connecting the world and empowering people through payments. We are looking for intellectually curious people who want to be inspired and inspire others to change the world.

Engineering is a craft, and at Venmo we want the internals of our software to be as elegant as the end user experience we are designing. We spend our days scaling our payment backend services and building new features to meet and exceed our user\xe2\x80\x99s needs and wants. We teach and learn from one another, and push each other to be at our creative and analytical best. We work to push our technology forward with respect to functionality, performance, reliability and scalability.

Risk Senior Software Engineer

As a Senior Software Engineer for Venmo Risk Engineering you will be involved in the design and development of product solutions that help fight financial fraud, tackle chargebacks & disputes handling in the world of connected payments. Venmo fraud product solutions supports screening payment transactions of 27.4 million monthly active users and had a transaction volume of 100 billion dollars in 2019. We have a YoY growth rate of 70%. Given all these fun challenges, we are a fast-paced organization going through rapid growth and solving technical challenges at exponential scale. As an organization, we have a strong culture of committing to goals and delivering on timelines.

We are looking for technologists with the highest levels of technical talent, programming skills, attention to performance and scalability, communication skills and a keen desire to deeply understand our product.

What You'll Do
Design, estimate and implement new and refactored software services on the platform securely, reliably and at scale. Take ownership for quality of design and implementation of software components
Deliver high quality code on time and follow our SDLC process
Work with Tech-leads / Architects to validate designs
Have an appetite to learn and contribute to complex projects alongside your colleagues
Interact with various non-engineering teams such as product, SRE, risk analysts and senior leadership
Participate in code reviews
Follow engineering best practices


What We're Looking For
4+ yrs experience in all phases of enterprise software design, development and testing
4+ yrs experience Java, Python or equivalent high level programming language
2+ yrs experience with RDBMS and NoSQL data stores , caching solutions (e.g. Redis, ElastiCache) and messaging/queuing protocols/systems such as Kafka/AMQP/RabbitMQ
Strong communication skills with the ability to understand and explain technical issues to a non-technical audience
Being collaborative, willingness to learn and also share/teach the team


What Will Really Get Our Attention
Experience in payments processing or payments domain
Experience in risk or compliance domains
Experience integrating disparate systems together
Django and/or Celery experience

We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don't hesitate to apply."

title: b'Software Engineer'
job description:

The epicenter of this transformation is the network\xe2\x80\x94our passion. Our experts are rethinking the purpose, role and usage of networks to help our customers increase bandwidth, expand capacity, enhance efficiency, speed deployment and simplify migration. From remote cell sites to massive sports arenas, from busy airports to state-of-the-art data centers\xe2\x80\x94 we provide the essential expertise and vital infrastructure your business needs to succeed. Work closely with other engineers to develop new products

Hands on of algorithm complexities
Development of the next generation software
Basic Database systems - indexes, filters
DOCSIS knowledge is preferable.

A computer science or electrical engineering bachelor's degree is required. Master\xe2\x80\x99s degree is a plus.

It is the policy of CommScope to provide Equal Employment Opportunities to all individuals based on merit, qualifications and abilities. CommScope does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, gender (including pregnancy), national origin, age or any other characteristics as protected by law. Furthermore, this contractor and subcontractor shall abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-300.5(a) and 41 CFR 60-741.5(a). These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified protected veterans and qualified individuals on the basis of disability, and require affirmative action by covered prime contractors and subcontractors to employ and advance in employment qualified protected veterans and qualified individuals with disabilities."

title: b'Junior Software Engineer'
job description:
b'Summary:
The main function of a software developer is to develop and design web applications and software. A typical software developer is responsible for directing web site content creation, enhancement and maintenance. Provides expertise and direction in the development and/or modification of computer-based scientific, technical, and business software systems.

The ideal candidate is a well-rounded technical professional with well-esablished technical, communication, and leadership skills. The new team member will be assigned to a project that is underway to rewrite a current system with modern, secure technology.
Key Skills:
The Senior Engineer must be able to demonstrate experience designing, re-designing, or updating legacy software systems, and become the subject matter and system expert.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Highly self-motivated individual who has the ability to work independently as well as in a team environment
\xe2\x80\xa2 Outstanding verbal and written communication skills
\xe2\x80\xa2 Able to guide, mentor, and lead team members
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to design, develop, test, support, maintain and debug software applications
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to analyze and resolve data issues
\xe2\x80\xa2 Establish and sustain successful relationships with high-profile executive stakeholders
\xe2\x80\xa2 Think critically and present complex technical information succinctly and accurately to a variety of audiences
Responsibilities:
This individual will engage in all development and database activities of the current system. He or she will collaborate in a team environment with other developers, management, and end users.
\xe2\x80\xa2 Participate in the full life cycle of development activities \xe2\x80\x93 define, develop, test, install, document, and maintain
\xe2\x80\xa2 Maintain a source control and inventory system to ensure proper version control
\xe2\x80\xa2 Create and maintain documentation, including data models, data dictionaries, stored procedures, functional and technical design documents, acceptance test plans, and production release schedules
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to translate system requirements into technical specifications, and to create visual diagrams of workflows, processes and data mapping for existing system and system modifications
\xe2\x80\xa2 Evaluate feasibility of enhancements requested by the user community
\xe2\x80\xa2 Respond to upgrades needed to comply with new regulations
\xe2\x80\xa2 Support activities and tickets with an internal Help Desk team who provides phone support to end users
\xe2\x80\xa2 Follow systems engineering, development, and deployment best practices The candidate will coordinate resources, standards, and established processes.
Programming Skills:
\xe2\x80\xa2 5+ years of experience in software engineering of web applications within the Microsoft stack (ASP.Net, C#/VB.Net, .NET Framework and/or .NETCore)
\xe2\x80\xa2 Solid understanding and practical knowledge of object oriented design and programming concepts
\xe2\x80\xa2 Comfort with Integrated Developer Environments such as Visual Studio
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience creating and maintaining data forms with tools such as .NET data binding for Windows applications
\xe2\x80\xa2 Familiar with source control systems such as Visual Studio Team Foundation or DevOps
Database Skills:
\xe2\x80\xa2 Expertise in writing queries as well as insert/update/delete SQL statements
\xe2\x80\xa2 Expertise in database management via direct UPDATES, embedded SQL and dynamic SQL such as stored procedures
\xe2\x80\xa2 Ability to document database design (Entity Relationship Diagrams, Dataflows)
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience in transforming business requirements to data objects and relationships
\xe2\x80\xa2 Applied use and understanding of database principles \xe2\x80\x93 entities, relationships, indexes, triggers, normalization
\xe2\x80\xa2 Experience writing stored procedures, functions, and packages'

title: b'Software Engineer, SDN / Networking / Embedded Systems'
job description:
b"Job description

Arista Networks is looking for world-class software engineers at multiple levels to join our team to build product features related to SDN, Routing Protocols, Network Management, Packet Forwarding Engines, Linux kernel and Network OS infrastructure. You will be part of a fast paced, high caliber team building the software for the routing and switching products used to build the industry's largest data center networks.  
At Arista, you will own your projects from definition to deployment, and you will be responsible for the quality of everything you deliver. You will also have the opportunity to work on multiple projects and areas based on business needs and personal interest.
This role demands a strong and broad software engineering background. Your role will not be limited to any single aspect of software development at Arista, but will cover all aspects of software development spanning the addition of new features, debugging problems and fine tuning code for scalability and performance.

Responsibilities:
Architect, design and develop features and solutions. Develop tests for all code to ensure quality. Fix bugs and refactor code as needed.
Review and contribute to the specifications and implementations written by other team members.
Provide technical leadership across features, projects and tools.
Work with Customer Support Engineers to analyze problems in customer networks and provide fixes. for those problems when needed in the form of new software releases or software patches.
Work with the System Test Engineers to analyze problems found in their tests and provide fixes for those problems.
Mentor new and junior engineers to bring them up to speed in Arista's software development environment.

Requirements:
At least BS Computer Science + 3 years' experience, or MS Computer Science + 2 years\xe2\x80\x99 experience, Ph.D. in Computer Science or equivalent work experience.
Knowledge of one or more of C++, Python, Go, C.
Knowledge of UNIX or Linux.
Understanding of IP networking and/or distributed systems.
Hands on experience in the design and development of Ethernet bridging or routing related software or distributed systems software.
Applied understanding of software engineering principles.
Strong problem solving and software troubleshooting skills.
Ability to design a solution and implement features independently. Ability to work on small teams solving problems by building features and driving the project with limited oversight..

Arista is an Equal Opportunity Employer: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

title: b'Software Engineer'
job description:
b'Software Engineer Opening in Natick, MA!

Apex Systems combines with parent company On Assignment to make it the 2nd largest IT staffing agency in the country.

Here Are The Details

Apex has an opportunity for a Software Engineer in the Natick area. This is a 6 month contract-to-hire position and the pay rate is flexible depending on experience.

For applicants who are interested in this Software Engineer opportunity; please send a Word resume to Matthew Bonvouloir, Technical Recruiter, at mbonvouloir@apexsystems.com.

Position: Software Engineer
Location: Natick, MA
Rate: Negotiable based on experience
Duration: 6 months contract-to-hire

Position Description

Our client is a startup company with a plan to disrupt the clinical testing market. The focus is on building NGS diagnostic and software solutions from the ground up, leveraging experiences in genomics, data analytics, clinical testing and patient focus to quickly innovate and penetrate the market.

We are seeking a software engineer who is passionate about solving data processing algorithm and computation challenges in genome technologies and applications to clinical diagnostics. The applicant will be responsible for providing software support for our core technology and product development, with opportunities to design and build the infrastructure for data management and analysis.

This exceptional opportunity offers the chance to work at big data analysis and cloud development supporting the forefront of genomic and cellular understanding of cancer. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to innovate and to work closely with experimental, regulatory, biological and clinical collaborators.

Responsibilities
Develop and maintain software packages for the analysis of DNA high-throughput sequencing data.
Work with software quality assurance and test engineers to evaluate algorithms and improve software products.
Work closely with data scientists to evaluate and troubleshoot experimental methods.
Capable of working in a team environment with good communication.
Be trained to understand and work with ISO/FDA compliance on some IVD related software products.


Required Skills

Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degree in Computer Science or related discipline.
Experience programming in a professional environment.
Demonstrated proficiency in Python or other scripting languages.
Familiarity with SQL and databases.
Proficiency in Linux and cloud computing.

Desired Skills (not required but candidate will have exposure to these skills in this role):

Extremely interested in software engineering problems as well as algorithm challenges.
Familiarity with TDD and BDD methodologies.
Knowledge of common bioinformatics tools and databases is a plus.
Experience in bioinformatics and NGS.

Additional Benefits

For this opportunity, you will also be eligible for benefits through Apex for the contract period, 401K, medical/health benefits options, a W2 hourly rate, weekly pay, and direct deposit!

EEO Employer

Apex is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Write, test, and refactor code that is elegant, clean, and adheres to patterns and established standards.

Integrate and deploy code using provisioning tools, release tools, and continuous Integration CI/Continuous Delivery CD pipeline.
Engineer installation qualifications and operational qualifications.

Project Delivery
Deliver complex products that are production hardened, high quality and on time based on the team's planning activities.
Contribute to common code.
Prioritize tasks based on communicated goals and business/product urgency.
In design reviews or PRs, spends bulk of time on issues pertaining to the code or feature.
Proactively identifies, clarifies, and fixes problems, inconsistencies or technical limitations of requirements.
Help define and participate in software development processes that leverages best practice and supports continuous product delivery.
Conform to all aspects of the software development life cycle.

Collaboration
Presents findings and responds to questions and feedback.
Perform research focusing on usability, scalability, performance and trade-offs, and share the knowledge with the team.
Clarifies assumptions, needs and goals upfront to minimize re-work.
Offers actionable and helpful feedback to others (pairing, design reviews, code reviews, etc).
Proactively participate in team planning activities and sprint ceremonies (including but not limited to: sprint planning, quarterly planning, and stand-ups).
Collaboration with other team members in working with stakeholders to define requirements based on user and business needs.


Other
Create new features for the Medical Reporting platform based on user feedback and business needs.
Provide consistent and on-going attention to the quality and reliability of the Medical Reporting software as a product.
Other responsibilities related to software engineering as assigned.


Qualifications

Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s Degree.
1+ year(s) of software engineering experience.


Preferred Qualifications
Degree in Software Engineering, Programming, Management Information Systems, Computer Science or related field.
2+ years of software engineering experience.
2+ year(s) of experience working with Amazon Web Services or similar cloud platform.
Prior experience with software patterns like Command Query Responsibility Segregation (CQRS) and Domain Driven Design.
Good understanding and experience with the Spring/Springboot framework.
Good knowledge and experience working with data modeling and database development techniques (Postgres/Oracle databases, JSON data, Database Transactions).
Architect complex software engineering solutions with an emphasis on creating highly performant services.
Experience building serverless applications, utilizing infrastructure similar to AWS SQS and Lambda.
Experience in genomics or other field of biology/biotech.
Expertise in highly automated continuous delivery environments.
Experience building and delivering software utilizing modern web technologies and tools (Javascript, HTML/CSS, application frameworks, etc.).
Experience with testing tools and processes associated with modern web technologies.
Experience building application features based on user input and requirement definition.
Experience with containerized delivery/deployment of software (Docker, Kubernetes, Amazon AWS ECS, etc.).
Strong interpersonal skills including collaboration and problem solving.
Understanding of HIPAA and importance of patient data privacy."

title: b'Software Engineer'
job description:
b"TL;DR

High-impact software development jobs for smart people.

Code that saves lives.

As a software developer at Epic, you\xe2\x80\x99ll write software that impacts the lives of 75% of Americans and 250 million patients around the world. Working in your own office, surrounded by thousands of high-caliber developers, you\xe2\x80\x99ll use modern development methodologies and employ user-centered design, analytics, and machine learning tools to drive innovation in healthcare. Using leading-edge technologies and languages like JS, TS, and C#, you\xe2\x80\x99ll invent better ways to reduce medical errors, streamline record sharing between hospitals, and provide the quality of care a patient deserves.

Write software for the most innovative health systems on the planet.

All the Top 20 health systems in U.S. News and World Report are Epic customers. Our community includes major systems like the Mayo Clinic, Johns Hopkins, Cleveland Clinic, and Kaiser Permanente, as well as leading academic medical centers at the University of Wisconsin, University of Michigan, University of California, University of Texas, The Ohio State University, and many more.

Work in your own office, eat delicious food, and travel the world.

We don\xe2\x80\x99t believe in cubicles. (Well, we believe they exist, but\xe2\x80\xa6) You will work in an individual office that will heighten your ability to get stuff done. For lunch, visit King\xe2\x80\x99s Cross or Cassiopeia for a wide array of meal options, or go to one of our smaller, themed bistros, featuring wood-rotisserie, pan-Asian, and Latin-inspired cuisine. All meals are restaurant-quality but cost only a few dollars, and they\xe2\x80\x99re prepared by a team comprised of kitchen talent from restaurants around the country. And, after five years here, you\xe2\x80\x99ll earn a four-week sabbatical anywhere in the world. Staff have kayaked in Patagonia, attended a Beyonc\xc3\xa9 concert in Ireland, built a library in Tanzania, and run a marathon in Antarctica.

Live affordably in a city known for its rising tech talent.

Epic is located just outside Madison, Wisconsin the second fastest growing market for tech talent in the United States and home to the state capital and the University of Wisconsin. Madison, a city surrounded by water, has received accolades for being the greenest city in America (NerdWallet), the best city for renters (SmartAsset), fittest city in America (Fitbit), and, for the gamers, is one of a handful of US cities to have a Killer Queen arcade game, located at Madison\xe2\x80\x99s first arcade bar.

More than just important work.

We offer comprehensive benefits to keep you healthy and happy as you grow in your life and career, and your merit-based compensation will reflect the impact your work has on the company and our customers. You'll also be eligible for annual raises and bonuses, as well as stock grants, which give you an even greater stake in the success of Epic and our customers. Epic is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action (W/M/Vets/Disability) employer. Please see our full non-discrimination statement at https //careers.epic.com/EEO.

Requirements

Open to relocation to the Madison, WI area (we will bring you here to explore the city for yourself)
BS/BA or greater in Computer Science, Mathematics, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related field
A history of academic excellence or professional success
Eligible to work in the United States without visa sponsorship (persons with appropriate qualifications and eligible for TN status under NAFTA may apply)"
